skills.name: bootstrap-development
skills.definition: Build minimum infrastructure so coding agents can build the rest. Create just enough (Prompt Improver, Persona Store, Agent Executor, CLI Runner) that agents can construct remaining features through PRs.
steps: Test by having agents build remaining features
skills.success_criteria: Can run a command that spawns coding agents to build features, and they produce working PRs

skills.name: verification-workflow
skills.definition: Arena-style dialectic verification: Assess (parallel domain experts) → Challenge (adversarial scrutiny) → Arbitrate (synthesize verdict) → Learn (update KB and skills with methodology improvements)
steps: ASSESS: Run parallel domain expert agents to evaluate
CHALLENGE: Adversarial agent demands methodology, finds contradictions, verifies independently
ARBITRATE: Synthesize surviving facts vs refuted claims
LEARN: Store verified facts in KB, update skills with methodology improvements

skills.name: prompt-improvement
skills.definition: Analyze agent prompts for conflicts, ambiguity, missing output formats, and structure issues. Score and suggest improvements.

skills.name: agent-persona-management
skills.definition: Store reusable agent definitions as YAML files with system_prompt, model, temperature, requires_sandbox, and tags. Categories: assessment, verification, synthesis, research, coding, custom.

skills.name: e2b-sandbox-integration
skills.definition: Expose E2B sandbox operations through REST API: create, execute, pause/resume, logs, file operations. Integrate with workflows for hypothesis testing.

skills.name: parallel-agent-execution
skills.definition: Run multiple Claude Code agents in parallel using E2B sandboxes. Each agent gets isolated context, unique branch, dedicated log file. Use for multi-stream development, comprehensive audits, or trying different approaches simultaneously.
common_failures: CLI syntax: repo URL is positional, not subcommand
Git push needs token + remote URL config

skills.name: ralph-loop-autonomy
skills.definition: Long-running autonomous agent workflows using stop hooks. Loop continues until completion_promise is met or max_iterations reached. Use for TDD, task lists, large refactoring.
patterns: TDD: Code → Test → Fix → Repeat until green
Task list: Work through todo.md, mark items complete

relationships.description: Bootstrap enables agents to build features
Verification uses personas for assessors, challenger, arbiter
Ralph for sequential persistence, sandboxes for parallel isolation
